autofill module¶

Summary:

The following functions are used to update the parameters tab based on the input file used.

NOTE: The methods here are not technically part of the HARP class but can be used as if they are. They are separated from the harp.py file just for convenience. To run a method from this module in harp.py the following notation can be used start(self) rather than self.start().

autofill.auto_file_out(self)[source]¶

Auto fill to make output folder name. Just replaces ‘recons’ to ‘processed recons’ if possible

Parameters:self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
autofill.auto_get_SPR(self)[source]¶

Finds any SPR files.

NOTE: This might be a bit redundant as the SPR files are not essential and are copied over with any other file regardless

autofill.auto_get_derived(self)[source]¶

Updates the derived crop box line edit box on the GUI

NOTE: Only works for IMPC setup folder structure

  • While loop through OPT list.

  • See if one of them is either processed or on list.
    • Previously checked if processed or on list in get_channels()

  • If one of them is - Set as the derived crop box on the GUI

autofill.auto_get_scan(self)[source]¶

Auto find scan folder. Just replaces ‘recons’ to ‘processed recons’ if possible

Parameters:self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
autofill.check_if_on_list(self, name)[source]¶

A while loop is used to go through the processing table see if the channel is on the list

Used by get_channels

Parameters:
  • self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
  • name –
Return boolean:

True if channel is on list
autofill.error_check_chn(chn_dir)[source]¶

Checks the channel recon directory to see if it is a valid file

Used in get_channels

Parameters:chn_dir (str) – The channel directory to be checked
Return int:1 if error 0 or nothing if OK
autofill.folder_size_approx(self)[source]¶

Gets the approx folder size of the original recon folder and updates the paramters tab with the info.

Calculating the folder size by going through each file would take too long. This function just checks the first recon file and then multiples this by the number of recon files.

Output for display for the GUI will be in gb or mb depending on the size of the folder. This is done in size_cleanup()

Parameters:self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
Variables:self.f_size_out_gb (str) – The file size in gb. Modified here.

See also

size_cleanup()

autofill.get_channels(self)[source]¶

Updates the OPT list on the GUI

This method does the following: * Check if OPT is selected * look up recon parent folder and search for other available OPT channels * Make a list of these channels * Loop through this list and each channel to the OPT channel table (the parameters tab)

See also

error_check_chn(), get_crop_box() check_if_on_list()

autofill.get_crop_box(self, name)[source]¶

Checks if cropbox file exists for a given recon name

Used by get_channels

Parameters:
  • self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
  • name (str) – Recon name for which the cropbox path is to be checked
Return boolean:

True if cropbox path exists
autofill.get_name(self, name, suppress=False)[source]¶

Gets the id from the folder name. Then fills out the text boxes on the main window with the relevant information

Parameters:
  • self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
  • name (str) – Full folder name with path
  • suppress (boolean) – True warning messages are sent. False they are not.
Raises:
  • IndexError – Missing descriptor completely
  • ValueError – Incorrect format of descriptor

NOTE: Gather error messages from exceptions to display one combined error message at the end

autofill.get_pixel(modality, recon_log_file)[source]¶

Gets the pixel size from the recon log. Different regex required for OPT or uCT

Parameters:
  • modality (str) – OPT or uCT
  • recon_log_file (str) – recon log file full path
Returns:
autofill.get_recon_log(self)[source]¶

Gets the recon log from the original recon folder, also gets the pixel size information using get_pixel()

Parameters:

self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
Variables:

self.pixel_size (str) – Pixel size. Modified here.
Raises:
  • IOError – Can’t find recon log
  • Exception – Custom python exception. Can’t fin recon log

See also

get_pixel()

autofill.opt_uCT_check(self, suppress=False)[source]¶

Checks whether or not folder name contains reference to either opt or microCT

Updates the GUI options based on modality

Parameters:
  • self (obj) – Although not technically part of the class, can still use this method as if it was part of the HARP class.
  • suppress (boolean) – If True warning messages will spit out. If suppressed they won’t
Variables:

self.modality (str) – Changes based on the modality chosen. Value should be either ‘MicroCT’ or ‘OPT’. Modified.

  • f_size_out (float) –
  • approx_size –
